p: This is a group of plants mainly found in tropical and subtropical regions, with a few representatives in temperate regions (herbs). The family usually comprises aromatic herbs, shrubs, or, rarely, trees or vines, often armed with prickles or thorns. There are approximately 1000 species grouped into more than 30 genera, usually with essential oils and calcium oxalate crystals in their tissues. The family has ornamental ( Congea spp.), timber ( Citharexylum spp.), edible ( Priva spp.), and medicinal species ( Verbena spp.).
